metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0231 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The mod_cgid module in the Apache HTTP Server before 2.4.10 does not have atimeout mechanism, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (process hang) via a request to a CGI script that does not readfrom its stdin file descriptor.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0231` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-data - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-event - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-itk - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-prefork - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-mpm-worker - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2-utils - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
apache2.2-bin - 2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-macro - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
libapache2-mod-proxy-html - 1:2.4.7-1ubuntu4.22+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1').
apache2 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.7-1ubuntu4.1').
